apakāsati，apakassati  [Sk. apakarṣati，cf. apakaḍḍhati] 除去，捨（去）. ger. apakassa

Apakāsati，at Vin.II，204 is to be read as apakassati and interpreted as “draw away，distract，bring about a split or dissension （of the Saṅgha）”. The v. l. on p. 325 justifies the correction （apakassati） as well as Bdhgh’s expln. “parisaṁ ākaḍḍhanti”. -- Cp. A.III，145 & see avapakāsati. The reading at the id. p. at A.V，74 is avakassati （combd. w. vavakassati，where Vin.II，204 has avapakāsati），which is much to be preferred （see vavakassati）. （Page 50）
